content:
Diagnosis:
Extensive stage small cell carcinoma of esophagus

Previous treatment:
Cisplatin/Etoposide 4 cycles completed March 2024
Partial response after cycle 2
Progression confirmed on CT 15 April 2024

Current status:
Clinical deterioration with increasing dysphagia
Weight loss 6kg in 4 weeks
Performance status declined to ECOG 3

Recent investigations:
CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis 15 April 2024 - Progressive disease with increase in primary tumor size from 4.2cm to 6.8cm. New liver metastases segments 4 and 7.

Blood results:
Hb 98
WCC 12.4
Plts 234
Alb 28
ALT 145
ALP 456

Current symptoms:
Grade 3 dysphagia - tolerating liquids only
Chest pain requiring oxycodone 40mg BD
Fatigue limiting self-care

Assessment and Plan:
Significant clinical deterioration with confirmed progressive disease following first-line platinum-etoposide. Not fit for second-line chemotherapy due to performance status. Referring to palliative care team for symptom management. Urgent referral for esophageal stent placement. Will arrange community palliative care support.
